intro: Ormocarpopsis anosyana, commonly known as the African starfruit or African gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that resemble starfruits, which are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
